verses.verse: (Num. 1:53) Moreover those who were to camp before the tabernacle on the east, before the tabernacle of meeting, were Moses, Aaron, and his sons, (Num. 18:5) keeping charge of the sanctuary, (Num. 3:7, 8) to meet the needs of the children of Israel; but (Num. 3:10) the outsider who came near was to be put to death.

(Num. 3:43; 4:48; 26:62) All who were numbered of the Levites, whom Moses and Aaron numbered at the commandment of the LORD, by their families, all the males from a month old and above, were twenty-two thousand.

(Levites Dedicated Instead of the Firstborn) Then the LORD said to Moses: (Num. 3:15) “Number all the firstborn males of the children of Israel from a month old and above, and take the number of their names.

(Num. 3:12, 45) And you shall take the Levites for Me—I am the LORD—instead of all the firstborn among the children of Israel, and the livestock of the Levites instead of all the firstborn among the livestock of the children of Israel.”
So Moses numbered all the firstborn among the children of Israel, as the LORD commanded him.
And all the firstborn males, according to the number of names from a month old and above, of those who were numbered of them, were twenty-two thousand two hundred and seventy-three.
Then the LORD spoke to Moses, saying:
(Num. 3:12, 41) “Take the Levites instead of all the firstborn among the children of Israel, and the livestock of the Levites instead of their livestock. The Levites shall be Mine: I am the LORD.
And for (Ex. 13:13, 15; Num. 18:15, 16) the redemption of the two hundred and seventy-three of the firstborn of the children of Israel, (Num. 3:39, 43) who are more than the number of the Levites,

you shall take (Lev. 27:6; Num. 18:16) five shekels for each one (Num. 1:2, 18, 20) individually; you shall take them in the currency of the shekel of the sanctuary, (Ex. 30:13) the shekel of twenty gerahs.
And you shall give the money, with which the excess number of them is redeemed, to Aaron and his sons.”
So Moses took the redemption money from those who were over and above those who were redeemed by the Levites.
From the firstborn of the children of Israel he took the money, (Num. 3:46, 47) one thousand three hundred and sixty-five shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary.
And Moses (Num. 3:48) gave their redemption money to Aaron and his sons, according to the word of the LORD, as the LORD commanded Moses.
(Duties of the Sons of Kohath) Then the LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying:
“Take a census of the sons of (Num. 3:27-32) Kohath from among the children of Levi, by their families, by their fathers’ house,
(Num. 4:23, 30, 35; 8:24; 1 Chr. 23:3, 24, 27; Ezra 3:8) from thirty years old and above, even to fifty years old, all who enter the service to do the work in the tabernacle of meeting.
(Num. 4:15) “This is the service of the sons of Kohath in the tabernacle of meeting, relating to (Num. 4:19) the most holy things:
When the camp prepares to journey, Aaron and his sons shall come, and they shall take down (Ex. 26:31; Heb. 9:3) the covering veil and cover the (Ex. 25:10, 16) ark of the Testimony with it.
Then they shall put on it a covering of badger skins, and spread over that a cloth entirely of (Ex. 39:1) blue; and they shall insert (Ex. 25:13; 1 Kin. 8:7, 8) its poles.

“On the (Ex. 25:23, 29, 30) table of showbread they shall spread a blue cloth, and put on it the dishes, the pans, the bowls, and the pitchers for pouring; and the (Lev. 24:5-9) showbread shall be on it.
They shall spread over them a scarlet cloth, and cover the same with a covering of badger skins; and they shall insert its poles.
And they shall take a blue cloth and cover the (Ex. 25:31) lampstand of the light, (Ex. 25:37, 38) with its lamps, its wick-trimmers, its trays, and all its oil vessels, with which they service it.
Then they shall put it with all its utensils in a covering of badger skins, and put it on a carrying beam.
“Over (Ex. 30:1-5) the golden altar they shall spread a blue cloth, and cover it with a covering of badger skins; and they shall insert its poles.

Then they shall take all the (Ex. 25:9; 1 Chr. 9:29) utensils of service with which they minister in the sanctuary, put them in a blue cloth, cover them with a covering of badger skins, and put them on a carrying beam.
Also they shall take away the ashes from the altar, and spread a purple cloth over it.

They shall put on it all its implements with which they minister there—the firepans, the forks, the shovels, the basins, and all the utensils of the altar—and they shall spread on it a covering of badger skins, and insert its poles.

And when Aaron and his sons have finished covering the sanctuary and all the furnishings of the sanctuary, when the camp is set to go, then (Num. 7:9; 10:21; Deut. 31:9; Josh. 4:10; 2 Sam. 6:13; 1 Chr. 15:2, 15) the sons of Kohath shall come to carry them; (2 Sam. 6:6, 7; 1 Chr. 13:9, 10) but they shall not touch any holy thing, lest they die. “ (Num. 3:31) These are the things in the tabernacle of meeting which the sons of Kohath are to carry.

“The appointed duty of Eleazar the son of Aaron the priest is (Ex. 25:6; Lev. 24:2) the oil for the light, the (Ex. 30:34) sweet incense, (Ex. 29:38) the daily grain offering, the (Ex. 30:23-25) anointing oil, the oversight of all the tabernacle, of all that is in it, with the sanctuary and its furnishings.”
Then the LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying:
“Do not cut off the tribe of the families of the Kohathites from among the Levites;
but do this in regard to them, that they may live and not die when they approach (Num. 4:4) the most holy things: Aaron and his sons shall go in and appoint each of them to his service and his task.
(Ex. 19:21; 1 Sam. 6:19) But they shall not go in to watch while the holy things are being covered, lest they die.” (Num. 3:22)
(Duties of the Sons of Gershon) Then the LORD spoke to Moses, saying:
“Also take a census of the sons of Gershon, by their fathers’ house, by their families.
(Num. 4:3; 1 Chr. 23:3, 24, 27) From thirty years old and above, even to fifty years old, you shall number them, all who enter to perform the service, to do the work in the tabernacle of meeting.
This is the (Num. 7:7) service of the families of the Gershonites, in serving and carrying:

(Num. 3:25, 26) They shall carry the (Ex. 36:8) curtains of the tabernacle and the tabernacle of meeting with its covering, the covering of (Ex. 26:14) badger skins that is on it, the screen for the door of the tabernacle of meeting,

the screen for the door of the gate of the court, the hangings of the court which are around the tabernacle and altar, and their cords, all the furnishings for their service and all that is made for these things: so shall they serve.
“Aaron and his sons shall assign all the service of the sons of the Gershonites, all their tasks and all their service. And you shall appoint to them all their tasks as their duty.
This is the service of the families of the sons of Gershon in the tabernacle of meeting. And their duties shall be (Num. 4:33) under the authority of Ithamar the son of Aaron the priest.
(Duties of the Sons of Merari) “As for the sons of (Num. 3:33-37) Merari, you shall number them by their families and by their fathers’ house.
(Num. 4:3; 8:24-26) From thirty years old and above, even to fifty years old, you shall number them, everyone who enters the service to do the work of the tabernacle of meeting.
And (Num. 3:36, 37) this is (Num. 7:8) what they must carry as all their service for the tabernacle of meeting: (Ex. 26:15) the boards of the tabernacle, its bars, its pillars, its sockets,

and the pillars around the court with their sockets, pegs, and cords, with all their furnishings and all their service; and you shall (Ex. 25:9; 38:21) assign to each man by name the items he must carry.
This is the service of the families of the sons of Merari, as all their service for the tabernacle of meeting, under the authority of Ithamar the son of Aaron the priest.”
(Census of the Levites) (Num. 4:2) And Moses, Aaron, and the leaders of the congregation numbered the sons of the Kohathites by their families and by their fathers’ house,
from thirty (Num. 4:47) years old and above, even to fifty years old, everyone who entered the service for work in the tabernacle of meeting;
